title: Ajanta Caves
description: Rock-cut Buddhist cave monuments famous for their paintings and sculptures.

title: Nagarjunakonda
description: Buddhist heritage site in Andhra Pradesh with ancient stupas and archaeological remains showcasing Mauryan period.

title: Chandragiri Fort
description: Historic Andhra Pradesh fort with 16th-century architecture offering panoramic views of the surrounding region.

title: Red Fort
description: A symbol of India's sovereignty, built in red sandstone by Emperor Shah Jahan.

title: Meenakshi Temple
description: Ancient Hindu temple in Madurai known for its towering gopurams and intricate architectural details.

title: Qutub Minar
description: The tallest brick minaret in the world, representing Indo-Islamic architecture.

title: Charminar Museum & Mecca Mosque
description: Historic mosque adjoining Charminar monument, showcasing Indo-Islamic religious architecture.

title: Golconda Fort
description: Ancient fortress near Hyderabad with remarkable architecture and historical significance spanning centuries.

title: Sanchi Stupa
description: A Buddhist complex famous for its Great Stupa commissioned by Emperor Ashoka.

title: Gandikota Fort
description: 13th-century fort in Andhra Pradesh situated on the Pennar River with stunning ravine views.

title: Virupaksha Temple
description: Ancient temple at Hampi ruins dedicated to Lord Shiva, showcasing Dravidian architecture.

title: Tirupati Venkateswara Temple
description: One of the world's most visited religious sites, dedicated to Lord Venkateswara with stunning architecture.

title: Srirangam Temple
description: One of the oldest and largest temples in South India, dedicated to Lord Ranganatha with intricate carvings.

title: Khajuraho Temples
description: Group of Hindu and Jain temples famous for their intricate erotic sculptures.

title: Warangal Fort
description: Historic fort in Telangana with 12th-century architecture and ornate stone carved gates.

title: Ellora Caves
description: 34 rock-cut temples and monasteries dedicated to Buddhism, Hinduism, and Jainism.

title: Charminar
description: Iconic mosque and monument of Hyderabad, built in 1591 with Indo-Islamic architecture.

title: Lepakshi Temple
description: 16th-century Hindu temple in Andhra Pradesh renowned for intricate stone carvings and artistic murals.

title: Shore Temple
description: Ancient rock-cut granite temple in Mahabalipuram built during Pallava dynasty overlooking the Bay of Bengal.

title: Hampi
description: Ruins of the Vijayanagara Empire with magnificent temples, markets, and palaces.

title: Taj Mahal
description: An ivory-white marble mausoleum built by Mughal emperor Shah Jahan, symbolizing eternal love.

title: Mysore Palace
description: Royal palace with Indo-Saracenic architecture, showcasing the grandeur of the Wadiyar dynasty.

title: Brihadeeswarar Temple
description: UNESCO World Heritage site in Tamil Nadu with magnificent granite tower and Chola architecture.

title: Konark Sun Temple
description: 13th-century temple shaped like a colossal chariot dedicated to the Sun God.

title: Penusila Narasimha Temple
description: Ancient temple in Andhra Pradesh featuring a monolithic Narasimha idol carved from granite rock.
